subject: Figure Skating
lead_paragraph: The two-time world champion Stephane Lambiel of Switzerland edged the American Johnny Weir in the short program of the Cup of Russia yesterday in Moscow.Lambiel’s clean quadruple jump opened a combination and helped him move 0.34 points ahead of Weir. Lambiel led despite reducing his opening triple axel to a double.Andrei Griazev of Russia was third and showed no sign of injury in his precise jumps after tearing a ligament earlier this year.Earlier, Kim Yu-na of South Korea got off to a good start toward her second Grand Prix gold of the year by leading Yukari Nakano of Japan by 3 points after the women’s short program. Kim was one of three women to try a triple-triple, and the only one to succeed. In pairs, Zhang Dan and Zhang Hao of China took the lead over the Skate Canada winners Aliona Savchenko and Robin Szolkowy of Germany.
